text: the revolutionary air lasted throughout
the night in Kiev as protesters endured
freezing temperatures to protect their
encampment on Independence Square
commonly known as the Maidan but early
in the morning the focus quickly moved
to the Rada the Parliament riot police
rushed to defend a building as the
crowds gathered outside for the crucial
debate as the Ukrainian Parliament meets
in crisis section the building is ringed
by riot police and outside thousands of
people singing the Ukrainian national
anthem and calling and the government's
will resign
among the protesters Vitaly Klitchko a
former world heavyweight boxing champion
and now leader of Adar one of the
opposition parties this Prime Minister
and this president have to die and today
we expect diamond from Prime Minister
this is a battle for the future of
Ukraine whether it should move towards
joining the European Union as the
protesters want or stay close to Russia
which the government says is the safer
economic option for now the debate
inside Parliament was fierce and noisy -
opposition deputies could barely contain
their fury as they organized a vote of
no confidence in the government I asked
the hall to listen to me the Prime
Minister said in the name of the
government I want to apologize for the
actions of our law enforcement agencies
on the Maidan the president and the
government are deeply regretful about
what happened that was a reference to
the violent clearing of the square on
Saturday which inflamed the passions in
the end the government survived the vote
and the Prime Minister left but the
protesters have not and the outcome of
the latest battle for the future of
Ukraine is still uncertain
Daniel Sanford BBC news Kiev
